tile.name: emberforge_explorer
tile.description: A rugged dwarf‑scarred wanderer clad in heat‑worn armor, bearing a soot‑blackened hammer and a glowing ember lantern.

player.back_history: Archetype: Disgraced Dwarven Forge Apprentice. Backstory & Motivation: Once a promising smith in Kharaz‑Dûm, I was blamed for the Ashen Sundering and cast out. Haunted by shame, I seek redemption by entering the Emberforge Bastion to restore the Corrupted Core, reclaim the lost forge, and prove my worth. Visuals: I wear patched iron‑reinforced leather, a soot‑blackened helm with a cracked crystal visor, a massive hammer etched with ancient runes, and a lantern that burns with a steady ember glow. My skin is scarred from molten burns, and a faint ember tattoo flickers across my forearm, marking my oath to the forge.

tile_with_texture.name: emberforge_explorer
tile_with_texture.description: A rugged dwarf‑scarred wanderer clad in heat‑worn armor, bearing a soot‑blackened hammer and a glowing ember lantern.

texture.tileset_description: A gnome with a beard and a hat. It appears to be a warrior gnome with different armor. A small person with hat and beard.

items.description: The outermost corridors of Emberforge Bastion, choked with ash and the faint glow of distant lava rivers. Cracked basalt floors crunch underfoot, while rusted iron walls drip occasional molten droplets. The air smells of sulphur and hot metal, punctuated by the echoing clank of ancient machinery awakening.
items.name: The Smoldering Entrance

wall_tile.name: iron_veined_wall
wall_tile.description: Iron‑rich ore walls streaked with glowing magma veins

floor_tile.name: basalt_floor

items.description: A vast chamber filled with massive, dormant gears and pistons. Dim amber light filters through soot‑blackened windows, casting long shadows across the floor. The scent of oil mixes with metallic ash, while the occasional hiss of steam punctuates the low hum of residual power.
items.name: The Gears' Hall

wall_tile.name: copper_gear_wall
wall_tile.description: Copper‑patinated walls embedded with giant gear teeth

floor_tile.name: gear_plate
floor_tile.description: Steel plates worn smooth by centuries of rotation

items.description: Side tunnels leading to a secondary forge, where rivers of molten lava flow through stone channels. Bright orange and crimson light flickers across the walls, heating the air to a choking intensity. The smell of molten metal dominates, accompanied by the rhythmic clang of unseen hammers.
items.name: The Molten Forge Annex

items.description: Goblin‑controlled forges spew smoke and sparks. Jagged iron scaffolding supports crude machinery, and the air is thick with burnt coal and acrid chemicals. Flickering lanterns cast erratic shadows, while guttural goblin chatter reverberates off the walls.
items.name: The Goblin Foundry

items.description: A fortified corridor guarded by corrupted Aetheric Sentinels. The stone is etched with ancient runes that pulse faintly with unstable magmatic energy. A cold wind carries the scent of ozone and molten rock, while distant thunderous footsteps echo.
items.name: The Aetheric Guardpost

items.description: The deepest chamber houses the shattered Corrupted Core, a semi‑molten crystal fused with goblin mechanisms. Molten lava erupts sporadically, casting blinding flashes. The air roars with the combined hum of aetheric energy and bubbling magma, and the smell is a searing mix of sulphur, metal, and raw power.
items.name: The Corrupted Core

tile.name: emberheart_core_shard
tile.description: A pulsating fragment of the original Molten Forge crystal, its surface roiling with liquid fire trapped in amber glass, veins of molten magma coursing like veins, emitting a faint hum of ancient dwarven runes.

final_objective.back_history: The Emberheart Core Shard is the last uncorrupted piece of the Corrupted Core's original crystal, ripped from the heart of the Emberforge Bastion during the Ashen Sundering. Its pure aetheric resonance can either re‑ignite the dormant Molten Forge and restore dwarven mastery over fire, or, if wielded by the wrong hands, amplify the Core's chaotic feedback and doom the mountain. The shard was sealed deep beneath the lowest vault to prevent the corrupted energies from spilling outward. Only by retrieving the shard and carrying it back to the surface can the player either restore the ancient forge and bring prosperity to the realm, or seal the Core forever, ending the endless eruptions. Leaving it in the depths would allow the corrupted Core to continue corrupting the mountain, spawning ever‑greater horrors and dooming nearby settlements.

tile_with_texture.name: emberheart_core_shard
tile_with_texture.description: A pulsating fragment of the original Molten Forge crystal, its surface roiling with liquid fire trapped in amber glass, veins of molten magma coursing like veins, emitting a faint hum of ancient dwarven runes.

texture.tileset_description: Detailed iron spear.
